subdivision_of_building: i. An extension to the existing communal room in the south side of the property parallel to the main pedestrian entrance. ii. Infill and unit addition to the existing independent units at the north east side of the site. iii. All other units are independent of the existing buildings.

application_details.scheme_name: St. Mary's Convent and Nursing Home - Pavilion and Units

description: Erection of single storey sheltered accomodation units across the site with four units on the rear boundary, two extending existing units and two individual units, an extension to the existing day room by covering two small courtyards, a single storey pavillion in the same location incorporating the relocation of bins, a new pedestrian opening by the perimeter wall, vehicular parking and associated landscaping
site_name: St Marys Convent And Nursing Home
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the occupation of the new units, the details of the nomination arrangement of the accommodation should be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development maximises the utilisation for local residents 
Reason: To meet the needs of the borough's residents.

Condition : 5 - The heat pump hereby approved, shall not be used until a noise assessment to be submitted to and approved prior to its usage. The level of noise emitted from the heat pump shall be at least 10dB below the background noise levels at all times near to the noise sensitive receptors.
Reason: To prevent noise disturbance to nearby properties.

Condition : 6 - a)	The new planting of trees at the garden (23_5837_12_05_PP_1 in the Tree Survey & Arboricultural Impact Assessment) shall be carried out in the first planting season following the substantial completion of the outbuilding hereby approved and shall comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs', and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Recommendation for General Landscape Operations'. The new tree planted shall not be lopped or topped within a period of five years of planting and any if within five years die or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season and shall be maintained thereafter.
b)	The applicant should notify the local planning authority after the plantation of the new trees. Eleven new trees proposed in 23_5837_12_05_PP_1 would be registered as TPO trees.  
Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance.

Condition : 7 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied or brought into use until the 20 existing parking spaces to be formalised with clearly marked 2.4 x 4.8m bays.  
Reason: In order to ensure that safe parking spaces are made available.

Condition : 8 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied or brought into use until full details of highway works related to the widening of the Corney Road access, including changes to the existing footway and kerb lining, be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority.
Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the area and in the interests of highway safety.

Condition : 9 - Prior to the first use or occupation of the development full details (including manufacturers' specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities that accord with the West London Cycle Parking Guidance (for not less than six bicycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use before the development is first occupied or brought into use, The approved facilities shall be thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 10 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.
Reason: In order to protect the free flow and safety of traffic on nearby highways and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) hereby approved, the development shall have been constructed to achieve an internal water use of 105 litres/person/day or less.
Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.

Condition : 13 - Land quality � Preliminary Risk Assessment (Phase 1 desk study)
Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
No development shall take place until a preliminary non-intrusive risk assessment (Phase I desk study report) to identify possible areas and sources of land contamination which may exist on the site has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  It will establish what intrusive investigation or site remediation measures may be necessary before the development commences. This report will be prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes: 
(i)	The Phase I desk study report will include the aims and objectives, data collection, site reconnaissance (walk over survey) and development of the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) with preliminary risk assessment whereby risk of all potential pollutant linkages are evaluated with a risk category. 
(ii)	The report must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice.
(iii)	The report shall also make recommendations for the further gathering of information and/or intrusive investigation, to ensure that it will be possible to render the site safe for its proposed use.
(iv)	The Council requests that the risk assessment reports or site plans are sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 14 - Land quality - intrusive site investigation
Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
Following the completion of the Phase I desk study report, if intrusive investigations or gas monitoring is recommended, a Phase II site investigation must be undertaken.
No development other than necessary works to enable intrusive investigations shall take place until a Phase II site investigation report, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
This report shall identify the areas and sources of land contamination that exist on the site and identify the scope of site remediation measures necessary before the development commences.
The investigation shall be carried out by a competent person(s), based on the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) and on-site observations, to identify the extent and nature of contaminants. The initial CSM shall be updated accordingly following a tiered risk assessment based on the findings of the investigation, and where applicable, the report shall include proposals to deal with the identified contamination on site.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting Notes:
(i)	The report shall include details of such sampling of soil, soil vapour, ground gas, leachate, surface water and/or groundwater at such locations and depths as are considered to characterise the site conditions based on the initial Conceptual Site Model (CSM) and on-site observations during investigation work. 
(ii)	The investigation and the report must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice.
(iii)	Further investigation shall be carried out at such locations and at such depths as the local planning authority may stipulate if this report  is found to be i

Condition : 15 - Land quality � Remediation Method Statement/ Remediation Strategy
Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved:
If a scheme for remediation is recommended in the Phase II site investigation for the site, no development shall take place until a remediation method statement prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person to specify the works necessary to render the site suitable for its proposed end use, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting Notes:
(i)	The remediation method statement shall provide suitable details of how the risks of each pollutant linkages, as identified in the updated Conceptual Site Model, will be mitigated.
(ii)	The report shall account for any comments made by the local planning authority. 
(iii)	Remediation work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use.
(iv)	The Council requests that remediation method statement or site plans be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 16 - Land quality � additional/unexpected contamination found during development
During the development:
The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if any land contamination not previously identified is encountered during development. A competent person shall assess the contamination, where necessary, including soil and groundwater sampling and testing before any further part of the development that may be affected by the additional contamination that has been discovered continues.
A revised remediation method statement, prepared by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval within one month of the discovery of such contamination.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i)	Further remediation work to remove or manage additional contamination shall be carried out in accordance with the approved revised remediation method statement for verification and validation before the development is first brought into use. 
(ii)	In some instances, the local planning authority may require work on site to be ceased whilst the nature of additional contamination is investigated fully.
(iii)	The Council requests that the revised remediation method statement or any site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.

Condition : 17 - Land quality - verification and validation of remedial work
Prior to the development is first brought into use:
The agreed scheme for remediation, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented. A verification report produced upon completion of the remediation by a suitably qualified, experienced or supervised person shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority for approval, before the development is first brought into use or in accordance with a programme approved in writing by the local planning authority.
Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.
Supporting notes:
(i)	The verification (closure) report shall revisit the conceptual site model and provide evidence that each aspect of the remediation plan has been implemented correctly and successfully in accordance with current UK guidance and best practice. Where applicable, the report shall describe how any additional/unexpected contamination encountered during development has been managed in line with the revised remediation method statement. 
(ii)	This report shall demonstrate that the development is suitable for its proposed use in terms of land quality.
(iii)	The Council requests that the verification report or site photos be sent electronically to landquality@hounslow.gov.uk as well as being submitted to the local planning authority for approval.
